column4: Hey there!:) I am trying to convert and dmg file to img file using dmg2img, however i keep getting an error: Inflation failed. Any idea what is going on ?
Maybe check if it has log somewhere or a verbose option?
It does indeed have a  verbose option. You want me to pastebin the output?
Do that, altough I'm not expert im at least willing to take a shot at it
http://pastebin.com/SmkZ4p4Z - Any help is appreciated:)
http://pastebin.com/na9yMB2s there is the debug log
What exact command are you using?
dmg2img <name of file> <name of output>
without <> ofcourse..
Tried sudoing the son of a b***, incase it was a permissions error. No luck :P
try dmg2img -s -i input.file -o output.file
Tried that now, still having an inflation error
Broken dmg is out of question i guess?
Indeed, tried several different ones, hoping everyones not corrupted. lol ^;
is there any way to burn a bootable .dmg "out of the box" of a program on linux ?
Sorry, thats out of my league. But im guessing you are trying to write the dmg on a disk?
Aye, attempting to write the dmg on a disk indeed
Gonna try to run it straight out of brasero, and see where that gets me with a hardboot on the mac
Good luck, i'll see if i can find something usefull
Looks like brasero is gonna make the dmg a iso for me befor eburning it ;o
thats nice
